intro: Eriogonum panguicense, commonly known as Panguinense buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes other familiar plants like sorrel and buckwheat. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Eriogonum panguicense is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
